data.content: To be activated, the init method must be executed. Unlike parallax which reasons by speed/multipliers, scrollTrigger allows you to reason in absolute values from point A (start) to point B (end).
The default subject to apply transformations to. If you use the pin property it will be applied to this element.
A DOM node other than item to be used as a reference for position, height, and width calculations.
A DOM node other than item to apply transformations to.

The scrollable node in which the target is contained.
The default is window.

A node that contains the scrollable element.
The default is window.
Reference breakpoint, it will be possible to add custom values in Default utils
Determines whether the scrollTrigger should be active from breakpoint up or up to the breakpoint.
Built-in properties can be used exclusively as single properties, to modify multiple properties or for more complex situations in general use one of scrollerTween/sequencer

items: tween: Use external scrollerTween/sequencer for complex animations

data.content: If no property is specified, scrollTrigger can only be used to track onEnter/onEnterBack/onLeave/onLeaveBack events
Property that defines the calculation of the distance value. Valid only if you use simple built-in properties (must be a string).

items: +/-100vw | +/-100vh: Move by ±100% of viewport width/height
+/-100w | +/-100h: Move by ±100% of element's own width/height
Properties are recalculated on each resize

data.content: Example: +/-0.5. The scale property is increased by 0.5 (default value is 0).
+/- number between 0 and 1 (default is 1).
'margin', 'padding-left', etc... Each value will be converted to px (no unit needed).
When using tween, the value is controlled by the sequencer/scrollerTween itself (no options available).
Alternative to the range property. Valid only for simple built-in transformations.

items: Transformation value calculated through a function

data.content: For complex animations, use a custom tween. You can use either a sequencer or the simplified scrollerTween which shares these methods:
scrollerTween only requires two properties: from and to (instead of multiple properties).
Defines the animation's start/end position (string with 3 optional values):
When start is bottom/right, animation begins when the item's top/left touches the specified value from screen's bottom/right.
When start is top/left, animation begins when the item's bottom/right touches the specified value from screen's top/left (reverse scroll).
The start value's reference edge (top/bottom/etc.) also determines the end value's reference edge.
Adds a value in vh|vw|px (use vh for vertical, vw for horizontal).

Adds the item's height/width (or half) to the final value.
Useful for element centering.

Values 2 & 3 are always added from the chosen position towards the screen center (regardless of top/bottom/left/right).
When starting from bottom, the reference is the top edge of the object.
To make the animation end when the bottom edge is 40px below the viewport top, simply subtract the element's height.
Alternative to start/end properties. Accepts an object with two parameters:

top | right | bottom | left
Functions identically to the equivalent in start/end.
Function that returns a number. Recalculated after each resize event.
Like start/end, this value is always added from the chosen position towards screen center (regardless of top/bottom/left/right).
Displays animation start/end indicators. Markers appear at the element's edge and fixed positions matching start/end values. Accepts a string parameter that displays beside the marker.
When enabled, uses Lerp or Spring instances for value updates.
Spring configuration presets: default | gentle | wobbly | bounce | scroller
Note: Spring doesn't work with the sequencer module (due to value clamping), but is compatible with scrollerTween.
Freezes elements like CSS position: sticky. Uses JavaScript positioning with anticipatory movement to prevent visual jumps. Elements may become direct body children if needed.
Boolean: When true, uses Spring for smoother pin release transitions
Boolean: Forces element to become a direct body child
Boolean: Activates pinning slightly early on page load (default: false)

items: Triggered when entering scroll range (no parameters)
Triggered when re-entering scroll range from bottom (no parameters)
Triggered when leaving scroll range (no parameters)
Triggered when re-leaving scroll range from top (no parameters)

data.content: Boolean: Disables GPU-accelerated transform: translate3d(0,0,0) during animations
Boolean: Throttles scroll events (configurable in Default utils)
Boolean: Applies perspective and transform-style: preserve-3d to parent elements
Boolean: Temporarily activates will-change during FPS drops (default: true)
Connects multiple ScrollTriggers or controls Parallax from a ScrollTrigger:

items: value: Current scroll position (avoids recalculation when shared between instances)

data.content: Recalculates all positions/measurements and updates rendering (automatically triggered on resize)
